paper_abstract: A large-scale deployment of two-color QCD simulations on the grid infrastructure called the FKPPL (France Korea Particle Physics Laboratory) VO has been carried out by use of Ganga Typically in this deployment there are a few hundred concurrent running two-color QCD jobs on the grid and are many jobs having a running time which lasts longer than 12 hours Thus there are premature terminations of running jobs due to the proxy lifetime and site-wide runtime limit of many grid sites To avoid these problems we have developed an application-level check-pointing and re-starting scheme that has been seamlessly integrated into the existing Ganga framework (C) 2010 Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Large-scale deployment of two-color QCD simulations on the grid using Ganga
